page.title: 01BURTON GREEN
page.content: {BURTON GREEN}is situated in green belt near Coventry.In the period c.1500 the boundry between Warwickshire and Berkswell down the middle of Cromwell Lane, one of the villages main roads. The demarkation line still exists,so that the services(refuse, water, electricity etc.) are admin. by 4 different authorities, namely, Stoneleigh Parish Council & Kenilworth Town Council in Warickshire & Berkswell Parish Council & Coventry City Council in the west Midlands. {Burton Green C.E. primary school}is partly in the Parish of St. Nicholas church.Children on opposite sides of the playground are in Berkswell Parish It was built 1875 as school/Chapel"of Ease"(from horse transport yard) there are still services held each month (110 years of tradition.).
